newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-FACTFILE OF MILAN COACH FABIO CAPELLO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FACTFILE OF MILAN COACH FABIO CAPELLO.

text.p: The following is a factfile of Fabio Capello, who returns to AC Milan as coach next season and who celebrates his 51st birthday on Wednesday:
1946 - Born in Pieris, near the north-eastern city of Gorizia, on June 18.
1964 - Made his serie A debut for Spal (Ferrara) against Sampdoria.
1967 - Joined Roma, coached by Helenio Herrera.
1970 - Moved to Juventus
1972 - May 13, made his debut for Italy against Belgium at the Parc Astrid in Brussels. Belgium won 2-1.
1976 - Joined Milan, played last match for Italy in a friendly against Portugal in Lisbon. Portugal won 2-1.
1980 - Retired as a player after 332 league matches in which he scored a total of 45 goals.
1985 - Became Milan youth coach
1986 - Had five games in charge of Milan.
1987 - Returned as youth team coach until 1991
1991 - Took over from Arrigo Sacchi as Milan coach
1996 - Joined Real Madrid as coach
1997 - Returned to Milan at end of Spanish season
Major honours:
Italian league title as a player: 1971-72 (Juventus), 1972-73 (Juventus), 1974-75 (Juventus), 1978-79 (Milan)
Italian league title as a coach (all Milan): 1991-92, 1992-93, 1993-94, 1995-96
Spanish league title (Real Madrid): 1996-97
Italian Cup: 1968-69 (Roma), 1976-77 (Milan)
European Cup: 1993-94 (Milan)
European Supercup: 1994-95 (Milan)
Other facts:
Played 32 times for Italy (won 18, drew 7, lost 7. Scored eight goals)
In 175 league matches as coach of Milan, his team lost just 17 times with eight defeats coming in the 1994-95 season.
In 1991-92, his debut season as coach, Milan were unbeaten.
